aboutSection3.title: Here are a few
aboutSection3.desc:
A group of friends discovered themselves motivated by a common goal - to lessen the hardships of a loved one enduring the everyday rigors of severe diabetes. And thus, Glucobelt was born - a device as ingenious as it was compassionate. What set their creation apart was its ability to predict sugar levels in food before consumption and in the blood without the need for painful needle pricks.
-Owee Prasad Adawadkar, Sanavi Chikhale, Mihika Tushar Datar
aboutSection3.desc1:
In the midst of a journey to Bangalore, they met remarkable painters and their vibrant creations. Their curiosity led to uncovering a disheartening truth: these skilled painters earned a meager monthly income of just 5000 rupees. This revelation became the driving force behind their project, Cartoonify.NFTs, earning them an invitation to a 6-week internship program In the same year, they earned recognition as one of the top 100 projects of ATL marathon 2021.
-Omkar Kumbhar, Dev Kore, and Param Shah , Karnataka
aboutSection3.desc2:
The trio understood the urgent need for a solution that would put an end to this plastic epidemic giving birth to REPLASTIC. Idea was that people could schedule plastic pickups from the comfort of their homes or offices through RePlastic's website. On the chosen date and time, a team of dedicated rag pickers, employed by the organization, would arrive to collect the plastic.They participated in the ATL (Atal Tinkering Labs) Marathon, a platform that celebrated innovation and problem-solving.
-Gunika Beriwal, Abhinav Tejpaul, and Satyam Verma

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.question1: What is the School Innovation Development Project?
faq.answer1: To promote a culture of innovation and creative problem-solving among school students, the Entrepreneurship Development, and Innovation Institute (EDII-TN), in collaboration with the Department of School Education (DoSE) and the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF), is implementing the School Innovation Development Project (SIDP).
faq.answer2: The objective of the program is to inspire students to solve problems by using a simple design thinking process as a method for innovation, collaboration, and acquiring 21st-century skills and leadership skills.
faq.question2: Which organization implements School Innovation Development Project?
faq.answer3: Entrepreneurship Development and Innovation Institute (EDII-TN), in collaboration with the Department of School Education (DoSE) and the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF), is implementing the School Innovation Development Project (SIDP).
faq.question3: Who can participate in this program
faq.answer4: Students from all government, government-aided, and partially-aided schools (both high school and higher secondary school) are eligible to participate in the program. Students from 9th to 12th standard can take part in this program. If you fall under this category but your school is not a part of SIDP, please contact us via email at sidp22-23@editn.in
faq.question4: What are the advantages and significance of providing 21st-century skills training to students?
faq.answer5: As students engage with UNICEF's video-based curriculum of 21st-century skills, they not only acquire foundational entrepreneurship skills but also develop other qualities such as problem-solving, innovation, and leadership skills throughout their educational journey.
faq.question5: Do students' innovations receive adequate protection?
faq.answer6: By creating awareness among students about Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), students can register and protect their innovations.
